title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for writing (or naming) either of the Brønsted-Lowry conjugate acid-base pairs with a clear indication of which is the acid and which is the base.

CH3CH2COOH and CH3CH2COO-

acid base

OR

H3O+ and H2O

acid base
descriptions:

acid base

OR

H3O+ and H2O

acid base

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for correctly solving for [H3O+].

[H3O+] = 10-pH = 10-2.79 = 1.6 x 10-3 M

1 point is earned for the Ka expression for propanoic acid

OR 1 point is earned for substituting values into the Ka expression.

[CH3CH2COO-] = [H3O+]

AND

[CH3CH2COOH] = 0.20 M − [H3O+], OR [CH3CH2COOH] ≈ 0.20 M (state or assume that [H3O+] << 0.20 M)

1 point is earned for correctly solving for the value of Ka.

K a = [ CH 3 CH 2 COO − ][ H 3 O + ] [ CH 3 CH 2 COOH] = (1.6× 10 −3 M) 2 0.20M =1.3× 10 −5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGlbWaaSbaaSqaaiaadg gaaeqaaOGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaGGBbGaae4qaiaabIeadaWgaaWc baGaaG4maaqabaGccaqGdbGaaeisamaaBaaaleaacaaIYaaabeaaki aaboeacaqGpbGaae4tamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0caaOGaaiyxaiaa cUfacaqGibWaaSbaaSqaaiaabodaaeqaaOGaae4tamaaCaaaleqaba Gaae4kaaaakiaac2faaeaacaGGBbGaae4qaiaabIeadaWgaaWcbaGa aG4maaqabaGccaqGdbGaaeisamaaBaaaleaacaaIYaaabeaakiaabo eacaqGpbGaae4taiaabIeacaGGDbaaaiabg2da9maalaaabaGaaiik aiaaigdacaGGUaGaaGOnaiabgEna0kaaigdacaaIWaWaaWbaaSqabe aacqGHsislcaaIZaaaaOGaamytaiaacMcadaahaaWcbeqaaiaaikda aaaakeaacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaikdacaaIWaGaamytaaaacqGH9aqpca aIXaGaaiOlaiaaiodacqGHxdaTcaaIXaGaaGimamaaCaaaleqabaGa eyOeI0IaaGynaaaaaaa@67D4@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
• 1 point is earned for noting that the statement is false AND providing a supporting explanation.

    False. The conjugate base of a weak acid undergoes hydrolysis (see equation below) at equivalence to form a solution with a pH > 7.

    (CH 3 CH 2 COO −  + H 2 O  ⇄  CH 3 CH 2 COOH + OH − ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaae4qaiaabIeada WgaaWcbaGaae4maaqabaGccaqGdbGaaeisamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaa beaakiaaboeacaqGpbGaae4tamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0caaOGaae iiaiaabUcacaqGGaGaaeisamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaakiaab+ea caqGGaGaeSiXHaOaaeiiaiaaboeacaqGibWaaSbaaSqaaiaabodaae qaaOGaae4qaiaabIeadaWgaaWcbaGaaeOmaaqabaGccaqGdbGaae4t aiaab+eacaqGibGaaeiiaiaabUcacaqGGaGaae4taiaabIeadaahaa WcbeqaaiabgkHiTaaakiaacMcaaaa@51B6@

  • 1 point is earned for noting that the statement is true and providing a supporting explanation.

    True. HCl is a strong acid that ionizes completely. Fewer moles of HCl are needed to produce the same [H3O+] as the propanoic acid solution, which only partially ionizes.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

  • 1 point is earned for noting that the statement is false AND providing a supporting explanation.

    False. The conjugate base of a weak acid undergoes hydrolysis (see equation below) at equivalence to form a solution with a pH > 7.

    (CH 3 CH 2 COO −  + H 2 O ⇄  CH 3 CH 2 COOH + OH − ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaae4qaiaabIeada WgaaWcbaGaae4maaqabaGccaqGdbGaaeisamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaa beaakiaaboeacaqGpbGaae4tamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0caaOGaae iiaiaabUcacaqGGaGaaeisamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaakiaab+ea caqGGaGaeSiXHaOaaeiiaiaaboeacaqGibWaaSbaaSqaaiaabodaae qaaOGaae4qaiaabIeadaWgaaWcbaGaaeOmaaqabaGccaqGdbGaae4t aiaab+eacaqGibGaaeiiaiaabUcacaqGGaGaae4taiaabIeadaahaa WcbeqaaiabgkHiTaaakiaacMcaaaa@51B6@

  • 1 point is earned for noting that the statement is true and providing a supporting explanation.

    True. HCl is a strong acid that ionizes completely. Fewer moles of HCl are needed to produce the same [H3O+] as the propanoic acid solution, which only partially ionizes.

The student response earns one of the following points:

  • 1 point is earned for noting that the statement is false AND providing a supporting explanation.

    False. The conjugate base of a weak acid undergoes hydrolysis (see equation below) at equivalence to form a solution with a pH > 7.

    (CH 3 CH 2 COO −  + H 2 O ⇄  CH 3 CH 2 COOH + OH − ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaae4qaiaabIeada WgaaWcbaGaae4maaqabaGccaqGdbGaaeisamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaa beaakiaaboeacaqGpbGaae4tamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0caaOGaae iiaiaabUcacaqGGaGaaeisamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaakiaab+ea caqGGaGaeSiXHaOaaeiiaiaaboeacaqGibWaaSbaaSqaaiaabodaae qaaOGaae4qaiaabIeadaWgaaWcbaGaaeOmaaqabaGccaqGdbGaae4t aiaab+eacaqGibGaaeiiaiaabUcacaqGGaGaae4taiaabIeadaahaa WcbeqaaiabgkHiTaaakiaacMcaaaa@51B6@

  • 1 point is earned for noting that the statement is true and providing a supporting explanation.

    True. HCl is a strong acid that ionizes completely. Fewer moles of HCl are needed to produce the same [H3O+] as the propanoic acid solution, which only partially ionizes.

The student response earns two of the following points:

  • 1 point is earned for noting that the statement is false AND providing a supporting explanation.

    False. The conjugate base of a weak acid undergoes hydrolysis (see equation below) at equivalence to form a solution with a pH > 7.

    (CH 3 CH 2 COO −  + H 2 O ⇄  CH 3 CH 2 COOH + OH − ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaae4qaiaabIeada WgaaWcbaGaae4maaqabaGccaqGdbGaaeisamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaa beaakiaaboeacaqGpbGaae4tamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0caaOGaae iiaiaabUcacaqGGaGaaeisamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaakiaab+ea caqGGaGaeSiXHaOaaeiiaiaaboeacaqGibWaaSbaaSqaaiaabodaae qaaOGaae4qaiaabIeadaWgaaWcbaGaaeOmaaqabaGccaqGdbGaae4t aiaab+eacaqGibGaaeiiaiaabUcacaqGGaGaae4taiaabIeadaahaa WcbeqaaiabgkHiTaaakiaacMcaaaa@51B6@

  • 1 point is earned for noting that the statement is true and providing a supporting explanation.

    True. HCl is a strong acid that ionizes completely. Fewer moles of HCl are needed to produce the same [H3O+] as the propanoic acid solution, which only partially ionizes.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for correctly calculating the number of moles of acid that reacted at the equivalence point.

1 point is earned for the correct molarity of acid.

Let x = moles of propanoic acid

then x=(0.02052 L​ NaOH)× 0.173 mol NaOH 1 L​ NaOH × 1 mol acid 1 mol NaOH MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0Jaaiikai aaicdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaaikdacaaIWaGaaGynaiaaikdacaqGGaGa aeitaiaaygW7caqGGaGaaeOtaiaabggacaqGpbGaaeisaiaabMcacq GHxdaTdaWcaaqaaiaaicdacaGGUaGaaGymaiaaiEdacaaIZaGaaeii aiaab2gacaqGVbGaaeiBaiaabccacaqGobGaaeyyaiaab+eacaqGib aabaGaaGymaiaabccacaqGmbGaaGzaVlaabccacaqGobGaaeyyaiaa b+eacaqGibaaaiabgEna0oaalaaabaGaaGymaiaabccacaqGTbGaae 4BaiaabYgacaqGGaGaaeyyaiaabogacaqGPbGaaeizaaqaaiaaigda caqGGaGaaeyBaiaab+gacaqGSbGaaeiiaiaab6eacaqGHbGaae4tai aabIeaaaaaaa@6A3A@

= 3.55 x 10-3 mol propanoic acid

3.55× 10 −3  mol acid 0.02500 L​ acid =0.142 M MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiaaiodacaGGUa GaaGynaiaaiwdacqGHxdaTcaaIXaGaaGimamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOe I0IaaG4maaaakiaabccacaqGTbGaae4BaiaabYgacaqGGaGaaeyyai aabogacaqGPbGaaeizaaqaaiaaicdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaaikdacaaI 1aGaaGimaiaaicdacaqGGaGaaeitaiaaygW7caqGGaGaaeyyaiaabo gacaqGPbGaaeizaaaacqGH9aqpcaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaigdacaaI0aGa aGOmaiaabccacaWGnbaaaa@55C7@

OR

Since CH3CH2COOH is monoprotic and, at the equivalence point, moles H+ = moles OH-, then

MAVA = MBVB

M A = M B V B V A = (0.173 M NaOH)(20.52 mL NaOH) 25.00 mL​ acid =0.142M MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGnbWaaSbaaSqaaiaadg eaaeqaaOGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaWGnbWaaSbaaSqaaiaadkeaaeqa aOGaamOvamaaBaaaleaacaWGcbaabeaaaOqaaiaadAfadaWgaaWcba GaamyqaaqabaaaaOGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaGGOaGaaGimaiaac6ca caaIXaGaaG4naiaaiodacaqGGaGaamytaiaabccacaqGobGaaeyyai aab+eacaqGibGaaeykaiaabIcacaqGYaGaaeimaiaab6cacaqG1aGa aeOmaiaabccacaqGTbGaaeitaiaabccacaqGobGaaeyyaiaab+eaca qGibGaaeykaaqaaiaaikdacaaI1aGaaiOlaiaaicdacaaIWaGaaeii aiaab2gacaqGmbGaaGzaVlaabccacaqGHbGaae4yaiaabMgacaqGKb aaaiabg2da9iaaicdacaGGUaGaaGymaiaaisdacaaIYaGaamytaaaa @6395@
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for correctly calculating the number of moles of acid that reacted at the equivalence point.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for disagreeing with the student's claim and making a valid justification using pKa, Ka, pH arguments.

1 point is earned for numerically comparing either: the two pKa values, the two Ka values, or the two pH values at the equivalence point.

Disagree with the student's claim

From part (b) above, pKa for propanoic acid is log(1.3 x 10-5) = 4.89. Because 4.83 is so close to 4.89, the pH at the equivalence point in the titration of butanoic acid should be close enough to the pH in the titration of propanoic acid to make the original indicator appropriate for the titration of butanoic acid.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for disagreeing with the student's claim and making a valid justification using pKa, Ka, pH arguments.

1 point is earned for numerically comparing either: the two pKa values, the two Ka values, or the two pH values at the equivalence point.

Disagree with the student's claim

From part (b) above, pKa for propanoic acid is log(1.3 x 10-5) = 4.89. Because 4.83 is so close to 4.89, the pH at the equivalence point in the titration of butanoic acid should be close enough to the pH in the titration of propanoic acid to make the original indicator appropriate for the titration of butanoic acid.
